text:
Pediatric blunt liver injury and coagulopathy managed with packs and a silo: case report.
 Packing the abdomen can be lifesaving when severe hepatic trauma is complicated by refractory hypothermia, coagulopathy, and continuing hemorrhage requiring large-volume transfusion.
 This report describes the successful use of abdominal packs and a modified silo in a child following blunt liver injury.
